Existence of normative provisions to implement a market of social services

#non-governmental service providers having access to budget (gov't) resources to provide social services in pilot areas

4410/A0/04/801/002.status_value: The on-going conflict continued to stagnate the social protection reform in 2015. No additional normative provisions were established in 2015. UNICEF with MOSP & MOF developed a new PFM algorithm which is based on the principle of "money follows the client.¿ In 2015  the costing methodology for social services was tested in two regions and submitted to government for approval. UNICEF also conducted capacity building through development of manuals on costing  planning and budgeting social care se
4410/A0/04/801/002.indicator_name: Status of the incorporation within the PFM system of outsourced and diversified social services and preventive services for children and families  the proportion of vulnerable children and families estimated to be reached by diversified services in pilot regions
4410/A0/04/801/002.baseline_value: Social services are not diversified  market for services does not exist (2011)

4410/A0/04/801/002.status_value: Annual Review with CSO and the government  the CPAP Indicator 1.2.2 was reformulated and reads: By 2016  regulatory provisions that systematically allow temporary alternative family-based care developed and operationalized. Baseline (2012): Three cities have regulatory provisions that allow temporary alternative family-based care (Every Child NGO pilots) Target: By end 2014  regulatory provisions that allow temporary alternative family based care are developed. By 2016  regulatory provisions th
4410/A0/04/801/002.indicator_name: Number of placements by responsible officials of children from crisis families in short-term  temporary alternative family-based care (without removing parental rights) in pilot regions

4410/A0/04/801/002.status_value: Subsequent to the Annual Review with CSO and the government  the CPAP Indicator 1.2.3 was reformulated and reads: National regulatory framework for mandatory non-residential programmes for children in conflict with the law (collaborating between law enforcement bodies and social services) as alternatives to custodial sentencing adopted and operationalized. Baseline (2012): 0 regions with alternatives to custodial sentencing. Target (2016): 5 regions with alternatives to custodial sentencing. Ukr
4410/A0/04/801/002.indicator_name: Number of referrals by responsible officials of children to mandatory non-residential programmes for children in conflict with the law as alternatives to custodial sentencing in pilot regions

4410/A0/04/801/001.status_value: While there were no periodical reviews conducted during 2015  last report on the progress of the implementation of the National Plan of Action for the CRC was provided in 2014 by a consortium of NGOs.
4410/A0/04/801/001.indicator_name: Number and periodicity of reviews undertaken by the Ministry of Social Policy on the implementation status of the outstanding CRC recommendations

4410/A0/04/801/001.status_value: A working plan of the Commission for 2015 developed and approved.  Meetings took place each quarter in 2015 (3 meetings during the year). Development of the new Law of Ukraine on CRC implementation 207-2021 was protocoled. The main finding of The Mid-term review of UNICEF-Ukraine CPD 2012-2016 were presented on the 2nd Inter-Ministerial Commission.
4410/A0/04/801/001.indicator_name: Number and significance of cross-sectoral child polices coordinated and endorsed by the Inter-ministerial Commission for Child Rights (or similar body)
4410/A0/04/801/001.baseline_value: 0 cross-sectoral child policies endorsed  there is no inter-ministerial coordination body for child policy (2011)

4410/A0/04/801/001.status_value: The Order made provision for state budget funding of 32 mln USD approximately for NPA implementation in 2015. Co-financing from local budgets was included  but the amount of funding was not defined.The NPA in 2014 wasn't financed because of the armed conflict.
4410/A0/04/801/001.indicator_name: Proportion of annual resource requirements of the NPA for Children that is funded from the State Budget  proportion NPA unfunded
4410/A0/04/801/001.baseline_value: 2 percent funded from State Budget (or 17 million UAH)  98 percent unfunded (2010)

4410/A0/04/802/001.status_value: Ukraine's continued conflict has slowed down its social service reform. Recognition has also been made by MOSP colleagues for administrations to be able to define a package of services  it is necessary for administrations to define the needs for services in communities. UNICEF  working with government and CSO partners  is currently testing and refining community need assessment instruments for annual assessment of service needs. This work was completed by end 2015 and submitted to central govern
4410/A0/04/802/001.indicator_name: Number of local governments that offer comprehensive and integrated package of preventive community-based services

4410/A0/04/802/001.status_value: Gatekeeping continues to be an issue requiring attention  particularly in light of the on-going flow of children from the conflict zone. UNICEF with government and CSO partners developed a draft case management instruction with the objective to enhance the decision-making process and overall social work interventions. Due to the conflict  the government has not reviewed this instruction for approval.  UNICEF continues to work with MOSP and CSO colleagues to strengthen case management approach  i
4410/A0/04/802/001.indicator_name: Number of local governments that use gatekeeping mechanism as a single entry into the system for vulnerable children

4410/A0/04/802/001.status_value: In 2013  the number of children under 3 entering institution care in Kharkiv Oblast dropped to 88 children (31% decrease) Displacement of children due to the conflict and the on-going violence has reduced the progress made earlier regarding children under-3 entering institutional care. In 2014  196 babies were placed in Kharkiv Oblast baby homes. 90 of them were replaced from conflict-torn territories of Donetsk and Luhansk oblasts. In 2015  99 children were put into baby homes  of them ¿ 49 are
4410/A0/04/802/001.indicator_name: Number of children under-3 entering institutional care in selected regions

4410/A0/04/802/001.status_value: Ukraine continues to face significant economic difficulties  which in 2014 resulted in the decision to remove funding from the central budget for the 12 000 social workers. The functions were not removed and there was the possibility for local administrations to cover these costs. Given limited available resources  only approximately 1 600 social workers of these initial 12 000 are currently working. Discussions about the need for stronger social work is recognized by MOSP colleagues  yet socio-
4410/A0/04/802/001.indicator_name: Ratio of social workers and/or child specialists to population (rural  urban)
4410/A0/04/802/001.baseline_value: current norm is as follows: Rural areas: 1: 2000 Urban areas: 1:4000 (2011)

4410/A0/04/802/001.status_value: There are several regions which have entities that provide early intervention services. In both Kharkiv and Lviv cities  early intervention services in line with international standards are provided by non-government agencies. Local city government colleagues collaborate with these NGOs but do not "outsource" or provide full budget support for these entities' activities. In 2015  Chugiev town in Kharkiv Oblast started to provide early intervention services as a result of UNICEF's intervention in
4410/A0/04/802/001.indicator_name: Number of local governments that apply early intervention services for children with or at-risk of disabilities that are in line with international standards

4410/A0/04/802/002.status_value: Fully met. The Government has adopted a Concept of the National Targeted Social Programme on HIV/AIDS. It includes the provisions on improved access to HCT for children in difficult life circumstances/MARA and pregnant women  PMTCT and integrated approach to medical and social care to HIV positive drug users including pregnant women. Based on the Concept  which is evidence-based and sound result of the work of UNICEF with many counterparts  the Government approved the new State Programme on HIV/

4410/A0/04/802/003.status_value: Although a bulk of activities had been postponed due to the emergency in the country a) public knowledge and attitude were addressed via RMCH communication regional strategies approved at the regional level  b) UNICEF trainings resulted in a decrease of refusals from immunization (up to 20 % depending on the locality). Counselling of pregnant women is being introduced into the practice of family doctors in targeted communities.
4410/A0/04/802/003.indicator_name: Parents in Ukraine have correct knowledge  positive attitude and receive adequate information regarding MCH core issues from health professionals  who exhibit positive non-discriminatory attitudes towards disadvantaged and most vulnerable children and families

4410/A0/04/802/003.status_value: Based on UNICEF developed counselling modules  the Shupik National Medical Academy of Postgraduate Studies has institutionalized a thematic advanced course on immunisation for family doctors and revised an antenatal care course. UNICEF developed modules were integrated in the new education programme for family doctors to be adopted in the first quarter of 2015.

4410/A0/04/882/004.status_value: Partnership between Ministry of Social Policy and Ministry of finance is in the process of formalization. Informally UNICEF has a strong partnership with mentioned line ministries  especially on the field of decentralization reform in Ukraine.

4410/A0/04/882/004.headline: The general methodology of costing of social services has been simplified for end-users at the local level. Recommendations were shared with Ministry of Social Policy for further consultations.
4410/A0/04/882/004.baseline_value: partnership is at the inception phaze
4410/A0/04/882/004.target_value: partnership between MoSP and Ministry of Finance is formalized

4410/A0/04/882/004.status_value: To support the development of the national standard of Early intervention  UNICEF in 2016  in close collaboration with Kharkiv based early intervention centre and medical child centre of Kharkiv  has developed the draft standard of early intervention that includes both technical and costing aspects. The aforementioned standard including costing parameters have been submitted to the MoSP for review and further endorsement.
4410/A0/04/882/004.indicator_name: Number of studies to cost social services supported by UNICEF  including opportunity costing  realized and presented to the IMCCR and other policy making fora

4410/A0/04/882/001.headline: A number of initiatives towards improving governance for children carrying results were achieved in 2016.

4410/A0/04/882/001.status_value: Reporting year on CRC for Ukraine is 2018.  Government entity for report drafting will be identified in 2017.  In 2016 upon request for support from MoSP UNICEF made rapid analysis  level completion of NPA on CRC implementation till 2016. Main findings were presented to key line ministries and local NGOs. During the meeting it was decided to use UNICEF's report as start point for the further reporting process on CRC.
4410/A0/04/882/001.headline: A number of initiatives towards improving governance for children carrying results were achieved in 2016.

4410/A0/04/882/001.status_value: With close cooperation between UNICEF and MoSP the National plan of action for 2016-2017 years on implementation of poverty reduction strategy in Ukraine was approved by Cabinet of Ministry. Thanks to UNICEF technical support new NPA included list of activities   with indicators of it implementation  aimed to support children in difficult life circumstances and improving child well-being.
4410/A0/04/882/001.indicator_name: (DEACTIVATED Jan 1 2017) Existence of advocacy and engagement to place child poverty as a national priority
4410/A0/04/882/001.headline: A number of initiatives towards improving governance for children carrying results were achieved in 2016.

4410/A0/04/882/001.status_value: Case management instruction drafted and submitted to the Government. 150 child protection specialists are trained on case management and child protection in emergency responses in TOT and training modules submitted to Ministry of Social Policy for integration into in-service training. Universal structure of the integrated service/ social support system is developed and provided to four pilot municipals for consideration of implementation. Case management tools were reviewed and analysed  with do
4410/A0/04/882/001.indicator_name: Case Management existing as a system in the country
4410/A0/04/882/001.headline: A number of initiatives towards improving governance for children carrying results were achieved in 2016.

4410/A0/04/882/001.status_value: MODA will be published in 2017. As a result of the national consultations  5 priority areas of potential deprivations for children were identified: living conditions  especially housing and utilities  access to healthcare services  leisure and access to information  education and neighbourhood safety. The preliminary results of the MODA study revealed  that the majority of households report insufficient funds to cover unexpected necessary costs using own resources (64%)  52% of households report
4410/A0/04/882/001.indicator_name: Existence of disaggregated data on the most excluded
4410/A0/04/882/001.headline: A number of initiatives towards improving governance for children carrying results were achieved in 2016.

4410/A0/04/882/002.headline: Measurable progress to enhance the ability of children and youth enabled to participate in the decision-making process and to claim their rights as rights holders were achieved.

4410/A0/04/882/002.indicator_name: Sustainable platform(s) where children and adolescents express their view on issues of concern to them are established and warrant that views of children are increasingly recognized by the GoU and Ukrainian society  as valuable to shape the future of their country.
4410/A0/04/882/002.headline: Measurable progress to enhance the ability of children and youth enabled to participate in the decision-making process and to claim their rights as rights holders were achieved.

4410/A0/04/882/003.indicator_name: National budgetary frameworks that address child poverty and disparities
4410/A0/04/882/003.headline: In 2016  the social protection dialogue was re-established. With the Ministries of Social Policy and Finance  UNICEF worked with regions to design a model for an integrated social support system. UNICEF obtained political agreement by MOSP to support the model&#39 s application within newly formed communities under decentralization.
4410/A0/04/882/003.target_value: addressed - with set of measurable indicators
